attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-SMQUqzMsqgz7N8_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, an aqlath can psychically manifest and hurl a shard of ice. This attack targets EAC and has a range of 40 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwGqirbCw05WimkWND_description
attribs.current: An aqlaths crown of horns is a psychic manifestation that allows them to wrench revitalizing energy from an enemys mind. An aqlaths crown always has as many protrusions as their current number of Resolve Points. When a creature fails a saving throw against one of the aqlaths mind-affecting spell-like abilities, the aqlath can spend 1 Resolve Point as a reaction to regain 40 Hit Points. When an aqlath has 0 Resolve Points (and therefore no more horns in their crown), they cant use their spell-like abilities.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MkwGk482vG6UXwWJCvX_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, an aqlath can psychically manifest and hurl a shard of ice. This attack targets EAC and has a range of 40 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_description
attribs.current: This spell functions as inflict pain, except as noted above.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_target
attribs.current: Up to 16 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_effect
attribs.current: Target takes a 2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks for 16 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes a 2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHBOQoY4JjmgNpktZ_description
attribs.current:
Aqlath divines the most vulnerable portion of its opponents mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

When the aqlath casts mind thrust as a 5th-level spell, it deals 15d10 damage to the target. The target is exhausted for 1 round if it fails its save and it is fatigued for 1 round if it succeeds at its saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHBOQoY4JjmgNpktZ_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Exhausted for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHBOQoY4JjmgNpktZ_save_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and Fatigued for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHKwBsLTfHpGCFEPu_description
attribs.current: This spell functions as hold person, except it can target any living creature.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHUDO58iygsMbadHY_description
attribs.current: For 24 hours, the target can read, understand, and communicate to the best of its ability in up to three languages that the aqlath already knows. This doesnt change the physical nature of the creature (if it lacks a means of speech, it still cant talk) or its attitude toward it. It does, however, allow intelligent creatures that normally have no language to understand and (if physically capable) communicate in the languages granted by this spell.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
A3. Destroyed Emplacement
During Combat The aqlaths rush into melee, attempting to gore their foes. When an aqlath is first reduced to 200 Hit Points or fewer or takes a critical hit, they step back to use their spell-like abilities and their psychic horns to regain Hit Points.

Morale Well aware that they arent likely to survive long anyway if the Sivv Dominion triumphs, the aqlaths fight until slain.

A4. Icy Ridges
During Combat Mounted on the hoarboar, the aqlath engages the most heavily armed PC right away.

Morale The aqlath is hoping for the glory of victory or an honourable defeat, so he fights to the death.

A5. Bunker Exterior
During Combat The aqlaths prefer to fight in melee, but they dont want to leave sight of the bunker entrance for fear an enemy could slip past them. They hurl ice shards at foes who remain at a distance.

Morale These vigilant guards fight to the death.

Aqlath Reinforcements
During Combat The aqlaths remain mounted for as long as they can to attack the PCs in melee.

Morale The aqlaths fight to the death.

attribs.current: A brood sovereigns invertebrate body is accustomed to navigating ocean depths. Theyre immune to damage related to changes in atmospheric or liquid pressure.

attribs.current: As a ranged attack, a brood sovereign can fire a horn-like dart with a range increment of 100 feet. This ranged attack ignores penalties for attacking underwater.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwM6SgOHgEDNEIqyLz_description
attribs.current: A brood sovereigns xenophobic rage is so great that they can radiate it from their bodies in both physical and psychic manifestations. As a full action, a brood sovereign can cause their tree-like crowns to spasm violently, sending out two 120-foot cones of concentrated psychic anger that can be aimed independently. A creature caught in the area of at least one cone takes 4d12+20 electricity damage as its brain and nervous system short out (Reflex DC 27 half).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwMQdfQ6uz8cKUSydV_description
attribs.current: A creature that takes damage from a brood sovereigns rage spasm ability must attempt a DC 27 Will saving throw. On a failure, the creature gains the panicked condition for 1d6 rounds. At the end of an affected creatures turn, it can attempt an additional saving throw to end the panicked condition early; on a successful save, its instead shaken for the remainder of the effects duration.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwN2ttdGO3T7Gv4nc9_description
attribs.current:
Brood sovereign divines the most vulnerable portion of its opponents mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

When the brood sovereign casts mind thrust as a 6th-level spell, it deals 17d10 damage to the target. The target is exhausted and stunned for 1 round if it fails its save, and it is fatigued for 1 round if it succeeds at its saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwNBQgURSxjaoakYHB_target
attribs.current: One Willing or Unconscious, Living Creature

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwNBQgURSxjaoakYHB_description
attribs.current: Psychic surgery heals the target of all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma damage, and it restores all points permanently drained from the targets Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It also eliminates all ongoing confusion, fear, and insanity effects. Psychic surgery also removes any mental afflictions that could be removed with dispel magic, as well as mental diseases. Psychic surgery removes all effects magically altering the targets memory, even instantaneous effects, and it can restore a memory to perfect clarity (even if the memory loss is due to the mundane passage of time).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwNHm6rdu-eF8pyrLU_description
attribs.current:
Brood sovereign fires a bright purple ray at its target, making a ranged attack against its targets EAC, but it can add its Charisma modifier to this attack instead of your Dexterity modifier if it is higher.

If the brood sovereign hits and its target fails its Will saving throw, it establishes a telepathic link with the targets mind and can control its actions. If the brood sovereign and the target have a common language, it can generally force the target to perform as it desires, within the limits of its abilities. If no common language exists, the brood sovereign can communicate only basic commands, such as Come here, Go there, Fight, and Stand still. It knows what the target is experiencing, but it doesnt receive direct sensory input from it, nor can it communicate with it telepathically. Once the brood sovereign has given a dominated creature a command, it continues to attempt to carry out that command to the exclusion of all other activities except those necessary for day-to-day survival (such as sleeping, eating, and so forth). Changing its orders or giving a dominated creature a new command is a move action.

By concentrating fully on the spell (a standard action), the brood sovereign can receive full sensory input as interpreted by the mind of the target, though it still cant communicate with it. It doesnt actually see through the targets eyes, but it still gets a good idea of whats going on.

The target resists this control, and any target forced to take actions against its nature can attempt a new saving throw with a +2 bonus. Obviously self-destructive orders are not carried out. Once control is established, the range at which it can be exercised is unlimited as long as the brood sovereign and the target are on the same plane. It doesnt need to see the target to control it.

If the brood sovereign doesnt spend at least 1 round concentrating on the spell each following day, the target can attempt a new saving throw to throw off the domination. It can be prevented from exercising control or using the telepathic link while the target is under the effects of some spells, but such effects dont automatically dispel the domination.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwNhbOzdpRV7gXMWih_effect
attribs.current: Target's Intelligence and Charisma scores drop to 1. In addition, it cannot use skills based on those abilities, cast spells, understand language, or communicate coherently.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwNhbOzdpRV7gXMWih_description
attribs.current: Brood sovereign fires a scintillating ray at its target, making a ranged attack against its targets EAC, but it can add its key ability score bonus to this attack instead of its Dexterity modifier if it is higher. If it hits and its target fails its Will saving throw, the target creatures Intelligence and Charisma scores each drop to 1 (a modifier of 5). The affected creature is unable to use Intelligence- or Charisma-based skills, cast spells, understand language, or communicate coherently. It still knows who its friends are and can follow them and even protect them. The target remains in this state until a miracle, psychic surgery, wish, or similar spell is used to cancel the effect. It cant be removed by effects like break enchantment.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwNyglLwTWCBnG3G3M_target
attribs.current: 20 ft.-Radius Spread around the Brood Sovereign

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwNyglLwTWCBnG3G3M_description
attribs.current: Brood sovereign stuns all creatures in range for 1d4 rounds. With a successful Will saving throw, a creature is instead sickened for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwO2PXOsQs-HzHEwoF_description
attribs.current:
This spell causes confusion in all creatures in the area, making them unable to determine their actions. Any confused creature that is attacked automatically attacks or attempts to attack its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused at the start of its next turn. Note that a confused creature will not make attacks of opportunity against any foe that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked). For confused creatures that have not been attacked, roll on the following table at the start of each affected creatures turn each round to see what it does in that round.

A confused creature that cant carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwO57Qg4FelZcAImiy_description
attribs.current:
With a single mental nudge, the brood sovereign can unlock one or more targets deepest nightmares. A target that succeeds at its Will saving throw against this spell is shaken for 1 round.

When the brood sovereign casts fear as 4th-level spell, it affects all living creatures in 30-foot cone-shaped burst regardless of CR. Each target must succeed at a Will save or become panicked for 1 minute. If cornered, a panicked creature begins cowering.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwMM4hYtu0hGe2GgH0_description
attribs.current:
If the brood sovereign hits with the indicated attack (usually a bite attack), it deals the normal damage. If the brood sovereigns attack roll hits the targets KAC + 4, it also automatically grapples the foe as part of the attack action. (If it hits the targets KAC + 13, it instead pins the target). The brood sovereign doesnt need to have a free limb to perform this grapple. The brood sovereign can swallow whole only targets that are at least one size category smaller than itself, and it has room for a single target of that size in its stomach (doubling the maximum number of creatures it can have swallowed for each additional size category by which these creatures are smaller).

On the brood sovereigns next turn after grappling or pinning the target, if the target hasnt escaped the grapple or pin, the target automatically takes the attacks damage at the beginning of the brood sovereigns turn. The brood sovereign can then make a new attack roll with the same attack. If the roll equals or exceeds the targets KAC, the grapple or pin is maintained. If the roll equals or exceeds the targets KAC + 4, the target is swallowed whole (no damage is dealt).

Once swallowed, the target takes the listed swallow whole damage automatically at the beginning of its turn every round. The target is considered grappled as long as its swallowed. The target can attempt to cut its way out (the interior of a creature with swallow whole has the same EAC as its exterior and a KAC equal to that of its exterior  4) by dealing an amount of damage equal to one-quarter the brood sovereigns total Hit Points, though any attack that doesnt deal slashing damage deals only half its normal damage. If a target cuts its way out of the brood sovereign, it cant use swallow whole again until that damage is healed.

Alternatively, a swallowed target can attempt to climb out. The swallowed creature must succeed at both a grapple check against the brood sovereigns internal KAC + 8 and an Athletics check to climb (DC = 35). Each of these actions takes a full round. If both checks are successful, the target climbs back up to the brood sovereigns mouth and can escape, ending up in an open square adjacent to the creature.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluEQqyrt3IPGnMhWxC_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a genesis wraith can cause branches to erupt from a nearby computer, access panel, or other technological item within 120 feet. The branches deal 3d12+17 piercing damage to the item and each creature in a 20-foot burst centred on the item (Reflex DC 24 half).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluEQqyrt3IPGnMhWxC_target
attribs.current: Computer, Access Panel, or Other Technological Item

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluEUZjK-NjVL9Y3zBQ_description
attribs.current: A genesis wraith exudes a 30-foot-radius aura of tolerable living conditions, similar to those provided by life bubble.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluEVjnTbZBrmtscHyJ_description
attribs.current: A creature struck by a genesis wraiths incorporeal claw must succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or take a cumulative 1 penalty to attack rolls, Reflex saving throws, and Dexterity-based ability and skill checks as they slowly turn to wood. Creatures with the plant subtype and plantlike universal creature rule have a +4 racial bonus to this saving throw. These penalties last for 10 minutes or until the genesis wraith is slain, whichever comes first. This is a curse effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluEVjnTbZBrmtscHyJ_effect
attribs.current: Target takes -1 penalty to attack rolls, Reflex saving throws, and Dexterity-based ability and skill checks.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MluDiNLm2BnmC5ls2fF_description
attribs.current: A creature struck by a genesis wraiths incorporeal claw must succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or take a cumulative 1 penalty to attack rolls, Reflex saving throws, and Dexterity-based ability and skill checks as they slowly turn to wood. Creatures with the plant subtype and plantlike universal creature rule have a +4 racial bonus to this saving throw. These penalties last for 10 minutes or until the genesis wraith is slain, whichever comes first. This is a curse effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluEYU28mjoiPNm6piB_description
attribs.current: Once per day, a genesis wraith can cast terraform as a spell-like ability (CL 17th) without having to spend credits. Any structure or starship within the area of effect takes 50 damage, ignoring hardness or Damage Threshold.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluEYU28mjoiPNm6piB_target
attribs.current: 100 ft.-Radius Emanation centred on the Genesis Wraith

attribs.name: abilities_menu
repeating_attack_-MluIOCCSUiRTyWqu7HG_type
attribs.current: Bludgeoning plus 10 ft.-Radius Area of Difficult Terrain Around the Spot Where the Debris Hit

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluIbSrdpfEOo0jeLnq_description
attribs.current: When an eclipse giant is in the presence of and can see either a solar or a lunar eclipse, theyre affected by greater resistant armour for as long as the eclipse lasts or until the giant can no longer see the eclipse, whichever comes first. Upon first being affected by greater resistant armour, the eclipse giant can choose to be protected against all kinetic damage or four types of energy damage; the giant cant alter this choice.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluK3AvOzqol5byaoKC_description
attribs.current: As a move action, an eclipse giant infuses the next bit of debris they hurl with healing or destructive energies. If they choose healing energy, the difficult terrain the debris creates is infused with healing energy for 1 minute; a creature that ends its turn in that area heals an amount of Hit Points equal to the giants CR. If the giant chooses destructive energy, their next hurled debris attack is made against EAC and deals additional force damage equal to the eclipse giants CR on a hit.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MluIOCCSUiRTyWqu7HG_description
attribs.current: The mighty strength of a giant allows it to turn nearly anything into a ranged weapon. A giant is assumed to have such debris available (either loose or readily torn from the environment without requiring an extra action) unless the GM rules otherwise. Hurled debris has a range increment equal to the giants Strength modifier  5 feet. Such attacks also create difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius area around the target, or a 10-foot-radius area for Huge and larger giants.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MluIOCCSUiRTyWqu7HF_description
attribs.current:
A Longsword is a straight, double-edged blade that typically protrudes from a haft. Modern longswords are made of stainless steel, carbon steel, or, rarely, a Custom material such as titanium or bainite.

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to Abilities that Target Technology. While this use of the word analogue is not technically correct when referring to Technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluIkwGRZlhfxvAM10w_description
attribs.current:
The targets severed body members (fingers, toes, hands, feet, arms, legs, tails, or even heads of multiheaded creatures), broken bones, and ruined organs (including eyes) grow back. After the spell is cast, the physical regeneration is complete in 1 round if the severed members are present and touching the creature. It takes 2d10 rounds otherwise.

Regenerate also restores 12d8 Hit Points, rids the target of exhaustion and fatigue, and eliminates all nonlethal damage the target has taken. It has no effect on nonliving creatures (including undead).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluIxrLAyHFYLV9kQqB_target
attribs.current: Up to 19 Medium Creatures or Vehicle

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluIxrLAyHFYLV9kQqB_description
attribs.current:
To use shadow walk, the eclipse giant must be in an area of dim light. They and any creature or vehicle they touch are then transported along a coiling path of shadowstuff to the edge of the Material Plane where it borders the Plane of Shadow. The effect is largely illusory, but the path is quasi-real.

All targets affected must be in direct contact with one another. A Large target counts as two Medium targets, a Huge target counts as four Medium targets, and so forth. Creatures the eclipse giant transports this way can opt to follow them, wander off through the plane, or stumble back into the Material Plane (50% chance for either of the latter results if the creatures are lost or abandoned by them). Creatures unwilling to accompany them into the Plane of Shadow can attempt a Will saving throw to negate the effect.

In the region of shadow, the eclipse giant moves at a rate of 200 miles per hour. Because of the blurring of reality between the Plane of Shadow and the Material Plane, they cant make out details of the terrain or areas they pass over during transit nor can they predict perfectly where their travel will end. Its impossible to judge distances accurately, making the spell virtually useless for scouting or spying. Furthermore, when the spell effect ends, they are shunted 1d10  100 feet ([[1d10*100]] ft.) in a random horizontal direction from their desired endpoint. If this would place them within a solid object, they (and any creatures with them) are shunted to the nearest empty space available, but the strain of this activity renders each creature fatigued (no saving throw).

Shadow walk can also be used to travel to other planes that border on the Plane of Shadow (except for the Drift), but this usage requires the eclipse giant to travel across the Plane of Shadow to arrive at a border with another plane of reality, which takes [[1d4]] (1d4) hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJL-DR39i-rPXNZHg_target
attribs.current: Up to 9 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJL-DR39i-rPXNZHg_description
attribs.current:
The eclipse giant twists the essence of life that flows through their targets, snuffing the spark out of weaker creatures and debilitating or disabling others. This spells effects depend on each targets CR.

A creature of CR 5 or lower is slain by this spell. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it is instead reduced to 1 Hit Point.

A creature of CR 610 takes [[10d20]] (10d20) damage and is stunned for 3 rounds. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it takes half damage and negates the stunned effect.

A creature of CR 1114 takes [[8d20]] (8d20) damage and is staggered for 3 rounds. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it takes half damage and negates the staggered effect.

A creature of CR 15 or higher takes [[8d20]] (6d20) damage. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it takes half damage.

Regardless of whether the target succeeds at its saving throw, it still might die from the damage this spell deals, though in this case the spell is not a death effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJXk6ki-fao0cIOmO_description
attribs.current: Stellar plasma rains down in the area, dealing 6d8 electricity damage and 6d8 fire damage to creatures and objects in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJctgtuanpe-P0fz6_description
attribs.current: The eclipse giant evokes a vertical column of dangerous material from across the universe that rains down upon creatures in the area. This matter is made up of bits of burning stars and chunks of frozen comets, and it deals 4d6 fire damage and 3d6 cold damage to every creature in the area. This damage occurs only once, when the spell is cast. For the spells remaining duration, the fallen starstuff makes the entire area difficult terrain, and thick, swirling clouds of particulate space matter magically block vision. This obscures all sight beyond 5 feet, including darkvision and other vision-based senses (including vision-based blindsight and sense through), but doesnt prevent blindsense. A creature within 5 feet of its attacker has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker cant use sight to locate the target). Additionally, the swirling cosmic particles are distracting to spellcasters in the area, who have a 20% chance of losing any spell they attempt to cast in the area. At the end of the duration, the starstuff disappears, leaving no aftereffects (other than the damage dealt).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJpZVMuggTgiPp9QP_target
attribs.current: Up to 19 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJpZVMuggTgiPp9QP_description
attribs.current:
The eclipse giant restores a number of Hit Points to a number of targets. Choose one of these targets within 10 feet of them; if that target regains all of its Hit Points as a result of this healing, the eclipse giant can apply the remaining healing to themself. On the other hand, if this isnt enough to restore all of that targets Hit Points, they can transfer any number of their own Hit Points to that target, healing the target that amount. They cant transfer more Hit Points than they have or more Hit Points than the target is missing.

The number of Hit Points mass mystic cure restores to each target depends on the spells level.

5th: 3d8 + the eclipse giant's Wisdom modifier

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJuQwspRv9SCWmj2Y_description
attribs.current:
With a touch, the eclipse giant heals and invigorate their target, restoring a number of Hit Points. If the target regains all of its Hit Points as a result of this healing, the eclipse giant can apply the remaining healing to themself. On the other hand, if this isnt enough to restore all the targets Hit Points, they can transfer any number of their own Hit Points to the target, healing the target that amount. They cant transfer more Hit Points than they have or more Hit Points than the target is missing.

Mystic cure restores a number of Hit Points to their target depending on the spells level.

5th: 9d8 + the eclipse giant's Wisdom modifier

In addition, unlike most healing, when the eclipse giant casts mystic cure as a spell of 4th-level or higher, they have two options to enhance its effects. The first option is to restore an extra [[7d8]] (7d8) Hit Points with a 5th-level mystic cure spell. The second option is to bring a target that died within 2 rounds back to life. In addition to healing such a creature, the spell returns the target to life, and the target takes a temporary negative level for 24 hours. This spell cant resuscitate creatures slain by death effects, creatures turned into undead, or creatures whose bodies were destroyed, significantly mutilated, disintegrated, and so on.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluJxqFLMFxhSIFGZ6N_description
attribs.current:
The eclipse giant pulls dormant mystical energy from the land and objects around them and use it to create a swirling eddy that batters their foes and can hinder their movement. The eddy deals 4d6 bludgeoning damage to each creature in the area. Additionally, creatures in the area are knocked prone and are reduced to half speed while the spell is in effect. A creature that succeeds at a Reflex save takes only half damage and is not knocked prone, but it is still reduced to half speed. Flying creatures within the eddys area must attempt an Acrobatics check to fly (DC equals the spells save DC) each round. Failure means the creature cannot move for that round.

The spell deals damage and knocks creatures prone only once. However, if a creature leaves the spells area and then returns, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above again (and can attempt another Reflex saving throw). Similarly, if a creature is not in this spells area when it is first cast but later moves into it, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above.

Small, unattended items (no more than light bulk) are also thrown around in the eddys area. At the end of the spells duration, such items land in a randomly determined space within the spells area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MluK00D6SGIY0u0Umi1_description
attribs.current:
The target gains a +4 morale bonus to saving throws against all spells and effects with the death descriptor. The target can attempt a save to negate such effects even if one is not normally allowed. The target cant gain negative levels and is immune to any negative energy effects. This spell does not remove negative levels the target has already gained, but it does remove the penalties from negative levels for the duration of its effect.

Death ward does not protect against other sorts of attacks, even if those attacks might be lethal.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Multiarmed (4), Preternatural Grace, Testament to History

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm5GKl0E9RcHUTtmN3P_description
attribs.current: When the mahadatari makes a multiattack with its slams, another set of four ghostly arms materializes and infuses the mahadataris corporeal arms with magic. All the mahadataris slam attacks gain the benefits of weapon fusions of the mahadataris choice until the beginning of their next turn. These weapon fusions must be able to be placed on melee weapons, and multiple fusions can be used on a single slam, but they cant have a combined item level greater than the mahadataris CR.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm5Ghi-rAEdmSZLqPJq_description
attribs.current: A mahadatari moves with almost unreal agility. As a swift action, they can spend 1 Resolve Point to be affected by haste for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm5GtlNWy54iP3sRAcr_description
attribs.current: A mahadatari can call forth the power of Kasaths deserts. As a move action, they surround themself with the swirling winds of a sandstorm. When a creature enters or begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 26 Reflex save or be blinded for 1 round and take 4d12 slashing damage (which counts as magic); on a success, it takes half damage and isnt blinded.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm5HLeyAGVTb-HgIGTY_description
attribs.current: A mahadatari is a testament to the history of Kasath and all its people. As a swift action, they can spend 1 Resolve Point to choose three combat feats whose prerequisites they meet and gain one of those feats for 1 minute. As a move action while benefiting from this ability, a mahadatari can exchange the chosen feat for one of the other chosen feats for the remaining duration or until they exchange the feat again.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm5HLeyAGVTb-HgIGTY_usage
attribs.current: Swift Action or Move Action; See Text

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsense (Vibration; 60 ft.), Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Ensnaring Military Degenerator Rifle with 2 High-Capacity Batteries (40 Charges each), Degeneration Grenades (2)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mm8S5cRhMOIQJ-Gyxal_description
attribs.current:
Sivv soldiers were armed with some version of the degenerator rifle, a two-handed longarm with improved range and destabilizing power. Like other sivv weapons, the rifle comes in two models: a less potent model intended for standard use and a more robust version used only by elite soldiers.

Hybrid
A weapon with this special property is a hybrid item, incorporating both magic and technology into its design. It counts as a magical weapon and gains the analogue weapon special property. It consumes ammunition and battery charges normally.

Ensnaring
The ensnaring fusion binds the target on a critical hit. On a critical hit with this weapon, the sivv sage-coffer can apply the entangle weapon special property. The entangle effect ends after 1 minute if the target has not already escaped it. If the weapon already has a critical hit effect, when the sivv sage-coffer scores a critical hit, it can apply either the weapons normal critical hit effect or the entangle effect. If it successfully affect a target with both the entangling and ensnaring fusions on the same attack roll, only the ensnaring fusion applies, and its use of the entangling fusion is not consumed. Only weapons that deal bludgeoning, cold, piercing, or slashing damage can benefit from this fusion.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mm8SL-kI1BcLolv47Ve_description
attribs.current:
Degeneration grenades were standard equipment among sivv soldiers. They create a powerful degeneration wave that affects creatures and objects at the subatomic level. Creatures caught in the explosion of a degeneration grenade must attempt a Fortitude saving throw as their cells begin to collapse; on a failure, the creature takes 5d6 fire damage at the beginning of each of their turns and is fatigued. At the end of each of their turns, the creature can attempt a new Fortitude save to end this effect with a cumulative +1 bonus.

Explode (11d6 A & So, Degeneration 5d6, 20 ft.)
Explosives have the explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When the sivv sage-coffer attacks with this type of weapon or ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If the explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. If it score a critical hit, it applies only to the creature closest to the targeted intersection (it chooses the creature if several are equally close). Some exploding weapons, such as smoke grenades, dont deal damage, so they dont include the damage and damage type entries.

Hybrid
A weapon with this special property is a hybrid item, incorporating both magic and technology into its design. It counts as a magical weapon and gains the analogue weapon special property. It consumes ammunition and battery charges normally.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mm8SL-kI1BcLolv47Ve_special
attribs.current: Explode (11d6 A & So, Degeneration 5d6, 20 ft.), Hybrid

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm8Sj0TKvNkOdBFy36Z_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the sage-coffer can force part of a foe into rel-state. The sage-coffer chooses a single limb on a non-sivv target within 30 feet. The target must attempt a DC 24 Reflex save. On a failure, the designated limb enters a phased quantum stateit and anything held in it cant be used. If the limb was used for locomotion, the target is flat-footed; otherwise, the target takes a 2 penalty to attack rolls. At the end of each of its turns, the target can attempt a DC 24 Fortitude save to end the effect. The effect ends on its own after 1 minute. If the sage-coffer spends 1 Resolve Point when they use this ability, they can choose up to three separate targets for this effect, no two of which can be more than 30 feet apart.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm8T41auVwvU55CQOMk_description
attribs.current: A sivv sage-coffer can enter rel-state on their own for a brief period. As a move action, they can spend 1 Resolve Point to become incorporeal and move up to their speed. They become corporeal at the end of their movement.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm8T6A564XuYhLCaovc_description
attribs.current: As a move action, the sage-coffer can shift an item in their possession into rel-state, quantum entangling the items molecules with their own. This effectively reduces the items bulk to 0 and makes the item impossible to disarm or otherwise remove from the sage-coffer, though the item cant be used. The sage-coffer can shift items weighing a total of 10 bulk, though no one item can be more than 4 bulk. The sage-coffer can retrieve an item from rel-state as a move action. Anything that the sage-coffer placed into rel-state becomes fully real when the sage-coffer is killed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm8T6A564XuYhLCaovc_target
attribs.current: One Item of No More than 4 Bulks

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Vitrum Plate, Military Quantum Entangler with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Military Degenerator Rifle with 2 High-Capacity Charges (40 Charges each), Mutation Gun with 1 Battery (20 Charges), Degeneration Grenades (2)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mm8VlGKH5GiEbO-Tosd_description
attribs.current:
Sivvs used these hand-to-hand weapons to capture and control enslaved creatures trying to revel. The tip of a long pole bonds with the target through quantum entanglement. Although a quantum entangler has a nonlethal stun setting, the occasional critical hit caused some victims to die in agony as their cells suddenly decayed and collapsed. The quantum entangler comes in two models; sivv soldiers commonly used the less potent version, while elite units used the more powerful version.

Grapple
When wielding a grapple weapon, the sivv warmaster can use it to perform a grapple combat maneuver without having its hands free. When it does so, it gains a +2 bonus to the attack roll, and if it rolls a natural 20 on the attack roll, it applies the weapons critical hit effect (if any) to the target.

Hybrid
A weapon with this special property is a hybrid item, incorporating both magic and technology into its design. It counts as a magical weapon and gains the analog weapon special property. It consumes ammunition and battery charges normally.

Powered (Capacity 20, Usage 4)
A melee weapon with an internal battery that must be charged to function has the powered special property, which lists its capacity and usage. Unlike with a ranged weapon, the usage is for 1 minute of operation rather than per attack, though using a powered weapon for less than 1 full minute still expends 1 full usage. The number of charges expended is equal to the usage  the number of minutes the weapon is used, rounded up to the nearest minute. The sivv warmaster can activate the power of the weapon as part of the action used to make an attack with it, and it automatically deactivates after 1 minute.

As with ranged weapons, the sivv warmaster can recharge the battery of a powered melee weapon using a generator or a recharging station, or it can purchase new batteries for it. If it tries to attack with a powered weapon thats out of charges, it functions as an improvised weapon (see page 169).

Reach
Only melee weapons can have the reach special property. Wielding a weapon with reach gives the sivv warmaster 10 feet of reach for attacks with that weapon. See Reach and Threatened Squares on page 255 for more information.

Stun
The sivv warmaster can set a weapon with the stun special property to stun mode (or reset it to normal mode) as a move action. While in stun mode, all the weapons attacks are nonlethal. See page 252 for more about how nonlethal damage works.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mm8VlGKH5GiEbO-Tosd_special
attribs.current: Grapple, Hybrid, Powered (Capacity 20, Usage 4), Reach, Stun

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mm8VoRhzPZ2lixZKEhm_description
attribs.current:
Sivv soldiers were armed with some version of the degenerator rifle, a two-handed longarm with improved range and destabilizing power. Like other sivv weapons, the rifle comes in two models: a less potent model intended for standard use and a more robust version used only by elite soldiers.

Hybrid

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mm8VuZduqdNgKfCZ-pU_description
attribs.current:
An experimental weapon, the mutation gun modifies the traditional degeneration beam projected by most sivv firearms into a form that rapidly destabilizes organic matter, sometimes resulting in random cellular mutations in the victims. This intimidating weapon was used during revolts by those enslaved, and its reputation alone quelled potential uprisings.

Antibiological
An antibiological weapon damages only living targets. Objects and creatures with the unliving special quality, such as robots and undead, are immune to its effects.

Hybrid
A weapon with this special property is a hybrid item, incorporating both magic and technology into its design. It counts as a magical weapon and gains the analog weapon special property. It consumes ammunition and battery charges normally.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm8WV3wXUwdZVt9yR6q_description
attribs.current: As a move action, a sivv warmaster unsettles its foes with a stern look bolstered by psychic conditioning. Each non-sivv creature within 30 feet is staggered for 1d4 rounds unless it succeeds at a DC 22 Will save. A creature staggered by this effect has a 2 penalty to attacks made against creatures with the sivv subtype, and it reduces the DC of its spells and abilities used against creatures with the sivv subtype by 2. This is a mind-affecting, sense-dependent effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm8WV3wXUwdZVt9yR6q_effect
attribs.current: Targets become staggered and take -2 penalty to attacks against creatures with the sivv subtype.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mm8WaJhJxMrAddRv8Z6_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a sivv warmaster can spend 1 Resolve Point to cast disintegrate as a spell-like ability with a caster level equal to its CR. The beam of energy forces many of the targets molecules into rel-state, potentially destroying it.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MnaaZky057h7uUyZcyr_description
attribs.current:
Speed 14

Limited Fire
A weapon with this special property can fire only the listed number of times in a starship combat encounter before it requires a brief period of time (10 minutes outside of starship combat) to recharge and rebuild the weapons inherent ammunition. A weapon with this special property is often a tracking weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mnaa9XCkYvDKtmWeZvx_description
attribs.current:
Point (+8)
A weapon with this special property is always short range and cant be fired against targets that are outside the first range increment. If a tracking weapon would hit a ship in an arc that contains a weapon with the point special property, the gunner of the targeted starship can attempt an immediate gunnery check with the point weapon against the incoming tracking projectile using the bonus listed in parentheses in the weapons Special entry (instead of her usual bonus to gunnery checks). The DC for this gunnery check is equal to 10 + the tracking weapons speed. If the attack hits, the tracking weapon is destroyed before it can damage the ship. A point weapon can be used to attempt only one such free gunnery check each round, but this usage potentially allows a point weapon to be fired twice in a single round.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MnabA4U19VDb82bfnma_description
attribs.current:
Aballonian vessels have a complex communications net, allowing them to share sensor data and tactical plans. A ship must have this system to participate in a data net, and a participating ship can go no further than long range from the closest vessel and remain in the net.

Ships with a data net determine their sensor distance to a target by counting the hexes between the target and any vessel participating in the network. In addition, if any vessel in the data net successfully performs a scan, target system, or lock on action against a target, all vessels in the net share that information and bonus. If the vessel was targeting a system, only the first critical damage is applied to the targeted system. Multiple lock-on bonuses do not stack. These shared bonuses apply even if the ship that performed the initial action is destroyed or disabled.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-Mnaap-1f901rGSKNPAL_description
attribs.current: A hangar bay can be installed only in a Gargantuan or larger starship and takes up 4 expansion bays. A hangar bay provides a place for up to 8 Tiny starships to dock.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MnaapWE75QarhQMOM9H_description
attribs.current: Occasionally, a starship will need to host an alien or other creature whose biology is radically different from that of the crew. The passenger might be able to breathe only methane gas or can survive in only below-freezing temperatures. In such a case, a sealed environment chamber is required for the passenger to remain comfortable (and alive).

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MnaapovCD9ZzyPT48fo_description
attribs.current: A science lab contains scientific apparatuses and other laboratory equipment to aid in the research of certain topics. A general science lab provides a +1 circumstance bonus to Life Science and Physical Science checks (and is called a general science lab), a life science lab provides a +2 circumstance bonus to Life Science checks, and a physical science lab provides a +2 circumstance bonus to Physical Science checks. The lab type is chosen when the expansion bay is converted.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MnaaqHX4XUR5ERKhfYE_description
attribs.current: A tech workshop contains all the space and tools necessary to craft technological items (see page 235), though the crafter must still provide the necessary raw materials. Such a workshop reduces the crafting time by half.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MnaaqbcsTpcylDbZ3M0_description
attribs.current: Unconverted expansion bays count as cargo holds. A cargo hold can contain approximately 25 tons of goods, with no item being larger than Large. A starship with multiple cargo holds can hold larger objects; usually 4 contiguous cargo holds are required to hold Huge objects and 8 for Gargantuan objects. These size restrictions can be overridden at the GMs discretion.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-Mnaaqu-FZYoAfsFHJC3_description

A starship with multiple cargo holds can hold larger objects; usually 4 contiguous cargo holds are required to hold Huge objects and 8 for Gargantuan objects. These size restrictions can be overridden at the GMs discretion.

These size restrictions can be overridden at the GMs discretion.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
A4. Icy Ridges
During Combat The hoarboar attempts to trample as many creatures as it can. It then gores chosen foes.

Morale The aggressive hoarboar fights to the death.

Aqlath Reinforcements
During Combat A hoarboar fights as its rider directs or attacks the PCs indiscriminately if its rider is killed.

Morale The stubborn and ferocious hoarboars fight to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaehbQz5Pi2hcVJKBY_description
attribs.current: As a full action, the hoarboar can move up to its speed and through the space of any creatures that are at least one size smaller than itself. The creature does not need to make an attack roll; each creature whose space it moves through takes damage. A target of a trample can attempt a Reflex save with DC 19 to take half damage; if it attempts the save, it cant make an attack of opportunity against the trampling creature due to the creatures movement. A hoarboar can deal trample damage to a given target only once per round.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The robot attempts to grab and eviscerate the nearest PC before moving on to the next. If unable to grab a PC, it fires its zero rifle.

Morale The robot fights until destroyed.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Extraction Room Robot|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Extraction Room Robot|engines_status}@{Extraction Room Robot|power_core_status}@{Extraction Room Robot|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaqUwLNamHqtBGy7Jr_description
attribs.current: An extraction room robot can perform swift and gruesome surgery on helpless creatures or creatures it has grappled. Against such a target, any hit with the robots tentacle counts as a critical hit with the severe wound critical hit effect (DC 23). If the robot scores an actual critical hit against such a target, the robot rolls the damage three times instead of twice, and the save DC increases to 25.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: D-Suit IV (Mk 1 Spell Reflector), Grindblade, Paragon Semi-Auto Pistol with 32 Rounds, Perihelion Artillery Laser with 2 Ultra-Capacity Batteries (100 Charges each), Mk 3 Screamer Grenades (2)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
C3. Robotics Workshop
During Combat Two kishalee seek cover behind the wrecked AHAV while the others move into melee. All of them prefer to focus their attacks on the same targets using their hunt foe ability.

Morale The kishalee are devoted but not suicidal. If two kishalee and the robot are defeated, the last two attempt to scramble over the palisade and escape if reduced to fewer than 40 Hit Points. Unlike the PCs, the kishalee can flee over the wall without difficulty, so if theyre able to escape, the PCs wont see them again.

C5. Command Post
During Combat As with the kishalee in area C3, one pair fires from behind cover while the other pair enters melee. The kishalee in melee attempt to flank their foes when possible. One of the hunters uses their hunting party ability as soon as they can.

Morale The commander has made it clear to these wardens that their likelihood of surviving their current deployment is negligible. They therefore each fight tenaciously to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mnas8IAzCIjyVbHfA9z_description
attribs.current:
The sharp edge of a grindblade has been crafted with advanced micropitting technology that turns it into a destructive rasp at close to the molecular level, capable of inflicting hideous damage. So sharp and savage is their edge that most grindblade designers dont even bother giving them a point.

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to Abilities that Target Technology. While this use of the word analogue is not technically correct when referring to Technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mnas8IAzCIjyVbHfAA-_description
attribs.current:
Artillery lasers are heavy weapons designed to be effective against hardened targets such as vehicles and enemy bunkers.

Penetrating
A penetrating weapon is designed to punch through large objects outer layers, making it easier to damage them. A penetrating weapon ignores an amount of hardness equal to the weapons level.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MnasHLtwF2g5CkOrmZ-_description
attribs.current:
The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent Cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to Abilities that Target Technology. While this use of the word analogue is not technically correct when referring to Technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MnasfRjDXW2t8-w2D2u_description
attribs.current:
When detonated, a screamer grenade releases a piercing shriek of sonic energy.

Explode (4d10 So, deafened 1d4 minutes, 20 ft.)
Explosives have the Explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When the kishalee warden Attacks with this type of weapon or Ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each Creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If they score a critical hit, it applies only to the Creature closest to the targeted intersection (they choose the Creature if several are equally close). If the Explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. Some exploding Weapons, such as smoke Grenades, don't deal damage, so they don't include the damage and damage type entries.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnareo7o5dOabEBQgSX_description
attribs.current: The blitz fighting style is all about using speed and aggression to get into the thick of melee. You increase your speed and responsiveness, gain abilities that make you better at melee combat than your enemies, and keep on fighting even when surrounded by foes.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnarlfr-z2Ca47s7-Bt_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, you can make a charge without the charge penalties (see page 248), and you can substitute a bull rush for the melee attack at the end of the charge. When you gain the soldiers onslaught class feature, you can make two attacks instead of one at the end of your charge, both with a 4 penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnarjV6MJSjuZ1BgegW_description
attribs.current: Youre a master of hunting all sorts of creatures, from big-game animals to runaway criminals and similar marks. You may use this expertise as a sniper, trophy hunter, sport enthusiast, or fugitive tracer. Far more focused on skills than other soldiers, your unique talents combine experience in the field with refined combat ability.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnarn0nTr43eUJj3ZMf_description
attribs.current: As a move action, the kishalee warden can choose one opponent that they have line of sight to and that they are aware of and attempt a Survival check (DC = 15 + 1-1/2  the creatures CR). Alternatively they can attempt this skill check against a creature that they cant see or arent aware of if theyve discovered and identified a set of tracks belonging to the chosen creature that are within 30 feet of them. If the kishalee warden succeeds, they gain a +1 insight bonus to damage rolls against the target, and to Bluff, Perception, Sense Motive, and Survival checks against them, as well as all skill checks to recall knowledge about them. The save DCs of their weapon attacks and soldier class abilities also increase by 1 against the target. They can maintain these bonuses against only one opponent at a time, and the bonuses remain in effect until their target is dead, they hunt a new target, or they end the effect without spending an action. If the kishalee warden fails the check to hunt their foe, they cant attempt to hunt any creature again for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnarn0nTr43eUJj3ZMf_mods
attribs.current:
+1 insight to damage
+1 insight to bluff
+1 insight to perception
+1 insight to sense motive
+1 insight to survival

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaropuhfeufZhRtZDZ_description
attribs.current: The kishalee warden can hunt two foes simultaneously using the hunt foe fighting technique, though each foe requires a separate move or swift action and a separate successful skill check to hunt. In addition, they can rally their allies to hunt their foes by spending 1 Resolve Point as a standard action, granting each ally within light of sight of them the benefits of their hunt foe style technique against their current designated target for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaropuhfeufZhRtZDZ_usage
attribs.current: Move or Swift Action; Standard Action, 1 Resolve Point

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnarqgwilSDJkT58-me_description
attribs.current: When the kishalee warden makes a full attack, they can make up to three attacks instead of two attacks. They take a 6 penalty to these attacks instead of a 4 penalty.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The siege robot is indiscriminate in its attacks, generally attacking whichever PC seems to pose it the most danger at the time. If the PCs retreat, the siege robot doesnt follow unless expressly ordered by the kishalee.

Morale The robot fights until destroyed.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision, Sense Through (Foliage, Gas, and Smoke Only; 60 ft.)

attribs.name: speed
attribs.current: 60 ft., Fly 20 ft. (Ex, Clumsy); Limited Flight

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Elite X-Gen Gun with 400 Heavy Rounds, Heavy Stellar Cannon with 800 Scattergun Shells, IMDS Missile Launcher with 2 Advanced Missiles

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaxZr5l25SSXTD0loV_description
attribs.current: Difficult terrain doesnt hamper a siege robots movement.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaxbRLawkxyX5mfcHM_description
attribs.current: A siege robot can reload its weapons as part of the same action used to fire them.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnaxe2S-GlDeswjEfY5_description
attribs.current: A siege robot takes half damage from explosives and collisions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaxfKpP8iewgFAR2YK_description
attribs.current: A siege robots thruster-based flight works in a vacuum, but in gravity, it can fly a maximum of 10 feet above the ground.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnaxgzqC2ZZfoFcnPZW_description
attribs.current: A siege robots nanites heal it, restoring a number of Hit Points per hour equal to its CR. Once per day as a full action, the robot can regain 10d8 Hit Points.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MnaxLXN1r3WjumOaaW-_description
attribs.current:
X-gen guns are named for their external generatora power pack that drives the automatic feed of the weapon. They are Common on fortified bases and in large armed encampments.

Automatic
In addition to making Ranged Attacks normally, a weapon with this special property can fire in fully automatic mode. No action is required to toggle a weapon between making Normal Ranged Attacks and using automatic mode.

When the siege robot makes a full Attack with a weapon in automatic mode, it can Attack in a cone with a range of half the weapon's Range Increment. This uses all the weapon's remaining Ammunition. Roll one Attack against each Target in the cone, starting with those closest to it. Attacks made with a weapon in automatic mode can't score Critical Hits. Roll damage only once, and apply it to all Targets struck. Each Attack against an individual Creature in the cone uses up the same amount of Ammunition or Charges as taking two shots, and once it no longer has enough Ammunition to Attack another Target, the siege robot stops making Attacks.

If more than one Creature is equidistant and the siege robot doesn't have enough Cartridges remaining to shoot at all equidistant creatures, determine randomly which one it Targets. It can't avoid shooting at allies in the cone, nor can it shoot any Creature more than once, even if it has enough Cartridges to fire more shots than it has Targets. Attacks in automatic mode take the same Penalties as other full Attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MnaxR8rvnlLKmqitzXU_description
attribs.current:
A stellar cannon is a portable, handheld cannon that fires exploding shells filled with dense flechettes that shred nearby Targets. Stellar cannons have a limited range, but they deal traumatic damage to large areas.

Blast
This weapon fires in a cone that extends only to its first Range Increment. The seige robot cant use it to Attack creatures beyond that range.

For each Attack the siege robot makes with a weapon with the blast special property, roll one Attack against each Target in the cone, starting with those closest to it. Each Attack takes a -2 penalty in addition to other Penalties, such as the penalty to all Attacks during a full Attack. Roll damage only once for all Targets. If it rolls one or more Critical Hits, roll the extra Critical Damage only once (or any other special effects on a critical hit that require you to roll) and apply it to each Creature against which it scores a critical hit. The siege robot cant avoid shooting at allies in the cone, nor can it shoot any Creature more than once.

Attacks with blast Weapons ignore Concealment. A blast weapon doesnt benefit from feats or Abilities that increase the damage of a single Attack (such as the operatives trick attack). Ammunition for blast Weapons is designed for blast Attacks, so the siege robot spends the usage amount only once for each cone of Attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mnay1LC7n9Nq-1VFNx8_description
attribs.current: IMDS (an acronym for individual missile delivery system) missile launchers are the most Common missile launchers currently on the market. IMDS launchers fire individual Missiles as Ammunition and use the damage listed for the Missiles fired out of them.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsight (Thermal; 60 ft.), Darkvision (90 ft.), Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The kishalee commander remains mobile, using the terrain to make trick attacks against the most dangerous enemy on the battlefield. If she realizes theres a foe she can see that her wardens cant, she focuses on that foe while directing her wardens to focus their fire on the other enemies. If unable to move around effectively, she instead makes quad attacks to deal as much damage as possible.

Morale The kishalee commander understands that the kishalee forces on this planet will crumble if she allows her prisoners to escape and obtain reinforcements, and she therefore fights to the death.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Operative Exploits (Into the Unknown, Uncanny Senses), Specialization (Explorer)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: D-Suit V (Mk 3 Thermal Capacitor), Molecular Rift Dagger, Zenith Laser Pistol with Super-Capacity Battery (80 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MngITPDVFI2bBWoRiYF_description
attribs.current:
The thinness and lightness of daggers make them easy to technologythat are so fine, their edges blur. The blade of a molecular rift dagger looks translucent, as if its made of glass, and its vibrating particles allow carry or conceal. Most daggers are available with fixed, folding, or retractable blades.

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to Abilities that Target Technology. While this use of the word analogue is not technically correct when referring to Technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

Operative
An Operative can use the trick Attack class feature with a weapon that has this special property. Any character can add her Dexterity Modifier rather than her Strength Modifier on melee Attack rolls with Weapons with this special property.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MngId7LZP8AYW5QDxtx_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most Common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngImZyHqy72W9DReYi_description
attribs.current: When the kishalee commander succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of her trick attack, she can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of her next turn. She might learn exploits that grant her additional options for her debilitating trick, but she can select only one option each time she hits with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngIrj4yZUepf2ean-x_description
attribs.current: When making a full attack using only melee weapons with the operative special property or small arms, kishalee commander can make up to four attacks instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngItXsnvsXOrZELW6r_description
attribs.current: The kishalee commander can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, she can move up to her speed. Whether or not she moved, she can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making her attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with her specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + her targets CR. If she succeeds at the check, she deals 9d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against her attack. She cant use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngIpKW2uZ8E8M58js5_description
attribs.current: When the kishalee commander hits an enemy with a trick attack, she can forgo her trick attack damage to increase the duration of the debilitating trick effect by 1 round. If she has the double debilitation ability, the duration of both debilitating tricks increases. Debilitating tricks with no duration (such as bleeding shot or knee shot) are unaffected.
