pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|engines_status}@{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|power_core_status}@{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MngO6Ey5GHWKv6FHi23_type
attribs.current: Bludgeoning plus 10 ft.-Radius Area of Difficult Terrain around the Spot Where the Debris Hit

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngPNFGkepjWbHRm1qw_description
attribs.current: The mighty strength of a giant allows it to turn nearly anything into a ranged weapon. A giant is assumed to have such debris available (either loose or readily torn from the environment without requiring an extra action) unless the GM rules otherwise. Hurled debris has a range increment equal to the giants Strength modifier  5 feet. Such attacks also create difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius area around the target, or a 10-foot-radius area for Huge and larger giants.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MngO6Ey5GHWKv6FHi23_description
attribs.current: The mighty strength of a giant allows it to turn nearly anything into a ranged weapon. A giant is assumed to have such debris available (either loose or readily torn from the environment without requiring an extra action) unless the GM rules otherwise. Hurled debris has a range increment equal to the giants Strength modifier  5 feet. Such attacks also create difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius area around the target, or a 10-foot-radius area for Huge and larger giants.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngPP0pk3TzU6N-aEem_description
attribs.current: Creatures within 60 feet of a moon giant are affected by its lunar aura as long as they remain within range. A creature that succeeds at its save against the aura is immune to that particular moon giants lunar aura for 24 hours. A moon giant can change the effect of the aura as a swift action, and the giant can choose whether to include itself as part of the same swift action. The giant can choose one of the following effects.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOWpwik9JAT4Q5waL_description
attribs.current: The indoctrinated moon giant evokes a vertical column of dangerous material from across the universe that rains down upon creatures in the area. This matter is made up of bits of burning stars and chunks of frozen comets, and it deals 4d6 ([[4d6]]) fire damage and 3d6 ([[3d6]]) cold damage to every creature in the area. This damage occurs only once, when the spell is cast. For the spells remaining duration, the fallen starstuff makes the entire area difficult terrain, and thick, swirling clouds of particulate space matter magically block vision. This obscures all sight beyond 5 feet, including darkvision and other vision-based senses (including vision-based blindsight and sense through), but doesnt prevent blindsense. A creature within 5 feet of its attacker has concealment (attacks have a 20% ([[1d00]]%) miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment 50% ([[1d00]]%) miss chance, and the attacker cant use sight to locate the target). Additionally, the swirling cosmic particles are distracting to spellcasters in the area, who have a 20% ([[1d00]]%) chance of losing any spell they attempt to cast in the area. At the end of the duration, the starstuff disappears, leaving no aftereffects (other than the damage dealt).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOZVGuDkVV0siY5y6_description
attribs.current:
The indoctrinated moon giant sends their mind to another plane of existence (an Elemental Plane or some plane further removed) in order to receive advice and information from powers there. The powers reply in a language they understand, but they resent such contact and give only brief answers to their questions. All questions are answered with Yes, No, Maybe, Never, Irrelevant, or some other one-word answer.

The indoctrinated moon giant must concentrate on maintaining the spell in order to ask questions at the rate of one per round. A question is answered by the power during the same round. They can ask seven questions. On rare occasions, this divination may be blocked by an act of certain deities or forces.

Contacting a minor planar power is relatively safe but may not result in useful answers. For each question the indoctrinated moon giant asks, the GM secretly rolls 1d20 ([[1d20]]).

12: The power gives the indoctrinated moon giant no answer, the spell ends, and they must attempt a DC 7 Intelligence check. On a failed check, their Intelligence and Charisma scores each fall to 8 for a week and they are unable to cast spells for that period.

35: The indoctrinated moon giant receives a random answer to the question.

610: The indoctrinated moon giant receives an incorrect answer to the question. Based on the nature and needs of the creature contacted, this may be a lie designed to harm them.

1115: The indoctrinated moon giant receives no answer to the question.

16 or More: The indoctrinated moon giant receives a truthful and useful one-word answer. If the question cant be truthfully answered in this way, no answer is received.

Contact with minds further removed from the indoctrinated moon giant's home plane increases the probability that they will incur a decrease in Intelligence and Charisma due to their brain being overwhelmed by the powers sheer strangeness and force, but it also increases the chance of the power knowing the answer and answering correctly. They can add any value from +1 to +5 to the d20 roll to represent contacting increasingly powerful planar beings. However, on a roll of 1 or 2, the result is still no answer, the spell ends, and they must attempt an Intelligence check to avoid losing Intelligence and Charisma. The DC of this Intelligence check is increased by the same amount added to the d20 check to contact a planar creature.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOdP5m7XtGrZiBqgH_description
attribs.current:
The indoctrinated moon giant places a terrible curse on the target, stealing either its overall competency or its ability to think and act on its feet. Choose one of the following.
The target takes a 4 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.
Each turn, the target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action.
The indoctrinated moon giant can also invent their own curse (see Afflictions on page 414 for a few ideas), but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The curse bestowed by this spell cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break enchantment, miracle, remove affliction, or wish spell.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity. Bestow curse counters remove affliction.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOjlOguUHSboullmJ_target
attribs.current: Up to Fifteen Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOjlOguUHSboullmJ_description
attribs.current: Each round, the indoctrinated moon giant concentrates on one target within range. They know if the target deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in its aura caused by lying. The spell does not reveal the truth or uncover unintentional inaccuracies, and it doesnt necessarily reveal evasions. Each round, they can concentrate on a different target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOpr59A9CJK1Q2SrG_description
attribs.current:
Similar to augury but more powerful, a divination spell can provide the indoctrinated moon giant with a useful piece of advice in reply to a question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity that is to occur within 1 week. Casting this spell requires them to expend 1 Resolve Point. The advice granted by the spell can be as simple as a short phrase, or it might take the form of a cryptic rhyme or omen. If they dont act on the information, the conditions may change so that the information is no longer useful. The chance for a correct divination is 75% ([[1d100]]%). If the die roll fails, they know the spell failed, unless specific magic yielding false information is at work.

As with augury, multiple castings of divination about the same topic by the same caster use the same die result as the first divination spell and yield the same answer each time.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOtWO7LHw5TYAizN8_description
attribs.current:
The indoctrinated moon giant gains access to the targets memories and knowledge, and they can pry the information they want from them involuntarily.

The indoctrinated moon giant can attempt to learn the answer to one question of their choice per round; after each question, the target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 20. If it fails its Bluff check, they gain the answer they desire. If it succeeds at its check, they gain no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and they believe that wrong answer to be the truth. Their questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into their mind. They and the target dont need to speak the same language, though less intelligent creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to their questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOy9LQ9G2buU5WSrq_description
attribs.current:
The indoctrinated moon giant creates an invisible magical sensor at a specific location that enables them to hear or see (their choice) almost as if they were there. They dont need line of sight or line of effect to create this sensor in a specific spot within range, but the locale must be either a place thats familiar to them or an obvious location, such as inside a cave whose entrance they can see.

The sensor doesnt move, but the indoctrinated moon giant can rotate it in all directions to view the area as desired. This spell functions only on the plane of existence you are currently occupying.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngP0a-oR5Iw3P4ApXX_description
attribs.current:
The indoctrinated moon giant grants the semblance of life to a corpse, allowing it to answer questions. They can ask up to six questions. The corpses knowledge is limited to what it knew during life, including the languages it spoke. Answers are brief, cryptic, or repetitive, especially if the creature would have opposed them in life.

If the dead creature was friendly or helpful toward the indoctrinated moon giant in life, the spell works automatically. Otherwise, the corpse can attempt a Will saving throw to resist the spell as if it were alive. On a successful save, the corpse can refuse to answer their questions or attempt to deceive them using its Bluff skill. The target can speak only about what it knew in life. It cant answer any questions that pertain to events that occurred after its death.

If the corpse has been subjected to speak with dead within the past week, this spell fails. The indoctrinated moon giant can cast this spell on a corpse that has been deceased for any amount of time, but the body must be mostly intact to be able to respond. A damaged corpse might be able to give partial answers or partially correct answers, but it must have at least a mouth in order to speak at all. This spell does not affect a corpse that has been turned into an undead creature.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
D2. Prisoner Restraints
Before Combat These moon giants have their waxing lunar auras active.

During Combat The giants attack the PCs as best they can, although their options are limited in the cramped space of this room and the adjacent hall. They rely on their slam attacks, although they eagerly try to crush Small or smaller foes if possible. The moon giants dont initially shift their lunar auras from waxing to waning, as they dont want to inadvertently cause their allies to fall asleep, but if the PCs eliminate two moon giants, the last of them switches their aura to waning.

Morale Loyal to the sivvs, the giants fight to the death.

D7. Meditation Chamber
Before Combat The moon giants each have their waning lunar auras active to provide for more relaxing meditation. The giants have all saved against one anothers auras, so they dont affect each other. Their soporific auras might still affect PCs who enter this room.

During Combat One giant casts call cosmos in the first round of combat to affect as many foes as possible. The others follow suit in subsequent rounds. They all hurl debris from around the room as long as they can stay out of melee reach, but rely on their slam attacks if forced into melee.

Morale Loyal to the sivv cause, the giants fight to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mr7ZKaBQVYre8EDk0Ix_description
attribs.current: Affected creatures fall asleep as deep slumber. The giants lunar aura is not limited by CR or Hit Dice.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mr7ZcAZFJjvxpdTS7H8_description
attribs.current: Affected creatures gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to the giants CR and gain the ability to make three attacks during a full attack, though each attack takes a 5 penalty (instead of a 4 penalty).

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Mature Solar Wisp|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Mature Solar Wisp|engines_status}@{Mature Solar Wisp|power_core_status}@{Mature Solar Wisp|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjqXaW3Z4lMFB9J3vn_description
attribs.current: A solar wisp increases the light level by one step out to a radius of 10 feet  half the solar wisps CR.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjqOtFaX3Wto6X2K-t_description
attribs.current: Once every 1d4 ([[1d4]]) rounds as a standard action, a mature solar wisp can hurl a portion of its burning form at a grid intersection within 120 feet, at which point the flames detonate, dealing 10d6 fire damage to all creatures within a 20-foot-radius burst. An affected creature can attempt a DC 24 Reflex saving throw to halve the damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjqYa8-fzIZC6QvjK5_description
attribs.current: A creature within 120 feet of a mature solar wisp has its speed reduced by half when it moves away from the solar wisp, and can move at double its speed when moving toward the solar wisp.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjqZRPeOgqA3pcrFT4_description
attribs.current: A mature solar wisp can project an intense ray of light as a ranged attack against a target within 240 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjqQqBOfkWjVXyTvtm_description
attribs.current: A creature adjacent to a mature solar wisp takes 3d12 fire damage from the intense heat that the elemental radiates. A creature that succeeds at DC 24 Fortitude save takes half this damage.

attribs.name: environment
attribs.current: Temperate or Warm Land or Vaccum

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The wisp uses its solar ray as frequently as possible, darting out of range if foes get too close. If at least three enemies are clustered together, it uses its conflagration ability to immolate them.

Morale The solar wisp hasnt lost a fight in its millennia of existence, so it fights until destroyed simply because it doesnt know when to quit.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MnjqUdVzmi71oIH3T05_description
attribs.current: A mature solar wisp can project an intense ray of light as a ranged attack against a target within 240 feet.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Advanced Frujai Soldier|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Advanced Frujai Soldier|engines_status}@{Advanced Frujai Soldier|power_core_status}@{Advanced Frujai Soldier|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat One frujai soldier uses its gravity anchor to reposition the PC who is closest to the entrance to the cargo bay, moving them further away. The other attacks with their slam. As they attack, the frujais telepathically shout, No! Go back! No! at their foes.

Morale The advanced frujai soldiers fight until destroyed. They pursue foes who flee south, but not those who escape through the northern exit.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjuQfUlq6FLrZZHQHj_description
attribs.current: Whenever a frujai colony takes damage, all frujai soldiers within 300 feet gain a +4 morale bonus to attack rolls and a 10-foot bonus to their base speed for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnjup2SdSz-UJ5ZbV-p_description
attribs.current: A frujai soldier can create violent fluctuations in gravity as a ranged attack against EAC with a 150-foot range and no range increment. If the attack hits, the soldier can attempt either a reposition or a trip combat manoeuvre against the target as a free action, using its gravity anchors attack bonus of +4 to perform the manoeuvre. When repositioning a creature in this way, the frujai soldier can move the target up to 10 feet from its original position.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjumWvIkGohWgt6UxO_description
attribs.current: A frujai soldier is able to control its apparent mass through a combination of organelles and psychic commands. It gains a +4 bonus to its KAC against bull rush, reposition, and trip combat makeovers. Furthermore, it can ignore the effect of supernatural gravity effects such as control gravity and can always behave as though natural gravity conditions were up to two steps stronger or weaker.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The armoured frujai first activates its orange force field. It then strides forward, making a gravity anchor attack if it cant reach any enemies by moving, but it fights in melee combat thereafter.

Morale The frujai soldier fights until destroyed. It doesnt pursue foes who flee north.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjwWkxBwBvWtstwWCN_description
attribs.current: Whenever a frujai colony takes damage, all frujai soldiers within 300 feet gain a +4 morale bonus to attack rolls and a 10-foot bonus to their base speed for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjwZYk3eZQ-CyDi9Za_description
attribs.current: A frujai soldier is able to control its apparent mass through a combination of organelles and psychic commands. It gains a +4 bonus to its KAC against bull rush, reposition, and trip combat makeovers. Furthermore, it can ignore the effect of supernatural gravity effects such as control gravity and can always behave as though natural gravity conditions were up to two steps stronger or weaker.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjwclU4eoTe08-8ry7_description
attribs.current: A frujai soldier can create violent fluctuations in gravity as a ranged attack against EAC with a 150-foot range and no range increment. If the attack hits, the soldier can attempt either a reposition or a trip combat manoeuvre against the target as a free action, using its gravity anchors attack bonus of +4 to perform the manoeuvre. When repositioning a creature in this way, the frujai soldier can move the target up to 10 feet from its original position.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjxsyoziLsZGPtxb7e_description
attribs.current: A frujai colony can control gravity in a variety of ways. At the beginning of its turn, a colony selects two of the following five abilities that it can use before the beginning of its next turn. By spending 1 Resolve Point, a colony can select three of the abilities that round instead. If a colony has a sustained ability active (such as flight or gravity field) and does not select that as one of its abilities for the turn, that effect ends immediately.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjyCYNIBaXu2PnyuRq_description
attribs.current: As a free action, the frujai colony gains an extraordinary fly speed of 40 feet (poor manoeuvrability). When this ability ends, the colony descends gently at a rate of 60 feet per round and takes no damage when it lands.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjyEJkcJlX2E1yS56p_description
attribs.current: The frujai colony can create a zone of abnormal gravity as a standard action, as per control gravity (CL 19th). A colony can maintain only one such effect at a time, and the abnormal gravity field ends if it uses this ability again.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjyFyrcAMZPgrWMNjH_description
attribs.current: The frujai colony combines levitating improvised shields with pulses of gravity to deflect attacks, gaining a +4 bonus to its AC.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjyHfGukhEyThXKSDd_description
attribs.current: The frujai colony can use its gravity thrust attack. This is a ranged attack against EAC with a maximum range of 200 feet and no range increment.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjybTvMfSCVJsBSE8Z_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the frujai colony can unleash a wave of force in a 60-foot cone that deals 8d6+17 bludgeoning damage to each creature in the area and pushes affected creatures 10 feet away from the colony. A target can attempt a DC 24 Reflex save to halve the damage and negate the movement.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjxuR-u2sKFWiK0caB_description
attribs.current: A frujai colony can sprout frujai soldiers (see below) naturally in a process that takes several weeks, but as a full action, a colony can expend 1 Resolve Point to create a temporary frujai soldier in an adjacent space; the soldier can act immediately. A temporary soldier remains animate for 1 hour before crumbling.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnjy4C-mjd0qaWQoBf4_description
attribs.current: A frujai colony is able to control its apparent mass through a combination of organelles and psychic commands. It gains a +4 bonus to its KAC against bull rush, reposition, and trip combat manoeuvres. Furthermore, it can ignore the effect of supernatural gravity effects such as control gravity and can always behave as though natural gravity conditions were up to two steps stronger or weaker.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnjybTvMfSCVJsBSE8Z_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Pushed 10 feet away.

attribs.name: abilities_menu
repeating_ability_-MkwH-SMQUqzMsqgz7N8_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, Kalthlo can psychically manifest and hurl a shard of ice. This attack targets EAC and has a range of 40 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwGqirbCw05WimkWND_description
attribs.current: Kalthlo's crown of horns is a psychic manifestation that allows them to wrench revitalizing energy from an enemys mind. An aqlaths crown always has as many protrusions as their current number of Resolve Points. When a creature fails a saving throw against one of Kalthlos mind-affecting spell-like abilities, she can spend 1 Resolve Point as a reaction to regain 40 Hit Points. When she has 0 Resolve Points (and therefore no more horns in their crown), she cant use her spell-like abilities.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MkwGk482vG6UXwWJCvX_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, an aqlath can psychically manifest and hurl a shard of ice. This attack targets EAC and has a range of 40 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_description
attribs.current: This spell functions as inflict pain, except as noted above.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_target
attribs.current: Up to 16 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_effect
attribs.current: Target takes a 2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks for 16 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwH-BzZF5huuSV41LJ_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes a 2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHBOQoY4JjmgNpktZ_description
attribs.current:
Kalthlo divines the most vulnerable portion of her opponents mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

When the Kalthlo casts mind thrust as a 5th-level spell, she deals 15d10 damage to the target. The target is exhausted for 1 round if it fails its save and it is fatigued for 1 round if it succeeds at its saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHBOQoY4JjmgNpktZ_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Exhausted for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHBOQoY4JjmgNpktZ_save_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and Fatigued for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHKwBsLTfHpGCFEPu_description
attribs.current: This spell functions as hold person, except it can target any living creature.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MkwHUDO58iygsMbadHY_description
attribs.current: For 24 hours, the target can read, understand, and communicate to the best of its ability in up to three languages that the aqlath already knows. This doesnt change the physical nature of the creature (if it lacks a means of speech, it still cant talk) or its attitude toward it. It does, however, allow intelligent creatures that normally have no language to understand and (if physically capable) communicate in the languages granted by this spell.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Kalthlo stays behind the medic capsule and uses her psychic powers, starting with mass inflict pain and then casting hold monster on unaffected foes. If she has reason to believe the PCs arent working for the sivvs and therefore might be allies, she breaks off combat immediately and offers to parley with them instead.

Morale Kalthlo surrenders if reduced to fewer than 150 Hit Points. She knows that the sivvs once put her on display rather than kill her, and she resigns herself to this fate again when its clear shes outmatched.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Armour Training, Keep Fighting (4d6+18), Rapid Recovery

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Nanotube Carbon Skin, Hardlight Staff, Transposition Key

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnk78xxVpzZCui3E-t2_description
attribs.current: The blitz fighting style is all about using speed and aggression to get into the thick of melee. Kalthlo increases her speed and responsiveness, gains abilities that make her better at melee combat than her enemies, and keep on fighting even when surrounded by foes.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnk75mx88Lxk9Z3hl7d_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Kalthlo can make a charge without the charge penalties (see page 248), and she can substitute a bull rush for the melee attack at the end of the charge. When she gains the soldiers onslaught class feature, she can make two attacks instead of one at the end of her charge, both with a 4 penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnk7EG4UDjlsQceHH5L_description
attribs.current: When Kalthlo hits a creature with an attack of opportunity, that creature cant move out of the squares she threatens until the start of its next turn. In addition, when an enemy takes a guarded step (see page 247) out of a square she threatens, she can make an attack of opportunity against it with a 2 penalty to the attack roll. If the target provoked an attack of opportunity by moving, hitting with her attack of opportunity ends the targets movement immediately, preventing it from carrying out the rest of its movement.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnk74GBgaKJv0ZTve2U_description
attribs.current: Kalthlo gains a bonus to melee damage rolls equal to double the number of enemies within 10 feet of her. Enemies who dont constitute a significant threat (those with a CR equal to your level  4 or less, or as determined by the GM) dont count when calculating this bonus.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnk7B3yijnf8Jgz3swZ_description
attribs.current: The guard fighting style focuses on defence. Kalthlo becomes adept at wearing armour, protecting against attacks, and enduring damage and other setbacks from attacks that get through her defences.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mnk6TXbzw2Ugev6OvkZ_description
attribs.current:
Staves are long and flexible, weighted on the end to provide extra striking power. Most staves are made from aluminium or fibreglass, though some are still made from wood.

Sentinel and repeller staves are made of conductive metal and deliver a painful, low-voltage charge that can stun opponents. The hardlight staff uses a core of unstable photonic gel to dramatically increase its mass every time it strikes a surface.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zNfudsli-29Bz5fp_description
attribs.current: A living hologram can hold perfectly still so that it appears to be a normal hologram. It can take 20 on Stealth checks to hide in plain sight as a hologram (usually among other holograms).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zUo1LkuJuF7xJIJZ_description
attribs.current: As living hologram, but the target is blinded for 1 round instead of dazzled on a critical hit (DC 24).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zZEWcEy2PCaKzgna_description
attribs.current: In most cases, it is difficult to completely destroy a living hologram in combat. A living hologram reduced to 0 Hit Points vanishes, though its corrupted projector reconstructs it in [[1d4]] (1d4) hours. The only way to permanently destroy a living hologram is to find its projector and either repair or destroy it. Living holograms are aware that their existences are tied to their projectors and protect the machinery at all costs.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zk7FQk9bdRFxor2t_description
attribs.current: A living hologram cant travel more than 100 feet from its projector. If it is ever forced to do so, it is immediately destroyed, though only temporarily (see rejuvenation above).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ2ygnRhGzMYFqRODYJ_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a living hologram can temporarily cause its fist (or a melee weapon, if it has been programmed to have one) to become substantial. This functions as a natural weapon that deals bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, the attack creates a bright flash of light, and the target must succeed at a DC 18 Reflex save or be dazzled for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2yqJtdeH7uZcXJgaH_effect
attribs.current: Target is fooled by the image.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2yqJtdeH7uZcXJgaH_description
attribs.current:
The living hologram weaves nearby photons into illusory holograms that can take almost any form it can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, robots, and living creatures.

4th: When the living hologram casts holographic image as a 4th-level spell, it produces a hologram as per the 3rd-level version of the spell, except the hologram follows a script determined by it. It follows that script for 17 minutes without the living hologram having to concentrate on it. The hologram can include intelligible speech, if it wish.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The hardened holograms use their hardlight slam attacks against whoever is closest to (or already has) the transposition key.

Morale The hardened holograms fight until destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkVW79a93Xb0OCUJNm_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a hardened hologram can physically alter its form to look like any Medium creature, as long as it has seen a similar creature before. It can attempt to either mimic a specific creature or look like a general creature of the chosen type. The hardened hologram gains a +10 bonus to Disguise checks to appear as a creature of the type and subtype of the new form. The DC of the hardened holograms Disguise check is not modified as a result of altering major features if it disguises itself as an aberration, a humanoid, or a monstrous humanoid (though the DC is still modified if the hardened hologram attempts to disguise itself as a different creature type). The hardened hologram can remain in an alternate form indefinitely or until it takes another form.

pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|engines_status}@{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|power_core_status}@{Indoctrinated Moon Giant|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MngO6Ey5GHWKv6FHi23_type
attribs.current: Bludgeoning plus 10 ft.-Radius Area of Difficult Terrain around the Spot Where the Debris Hit

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngPNFGkepjWbHRm1qw_description
attribs.current: The mighty strength of a giant allows it to turn nearly anything into a ranged weapon. A giant is assumed to have such debris available (either loose or readily torn from the environment without requiring an extra action) unless the GM rules otherwise. Hurled debris has a range increment equal to the giants Strength modifier  5 feet. Such attacks also create difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius area around the target, or a 10-foot-radius area for Huge and larger giants.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MngO6Ey5GHWKv6FHi23_description
attribs.current: The mighty strength of a giant allows it to turn nearly anything into a ranged weapon. A giant is assumed to have such debris available (either loose or readily torn from the environment without requiring an extra action) unless the GM rules otherwise. Hurled debris has a range increment equal to the giants Strength modifier  5 feet. Such attacks also create difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius area around the target, or a 10-foot-radius area for Huge and larger giants.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngPP0pk3TzU6N-aEem_description
attribs.current:
Creatures within 60 feet of a moon giant are affected by its lunar aura as long as they remain within range. A creature that succeeds at its save against the aura is immune to that particular moon giants lunar aura for 24 hours. A moon giant can change the effect of the aura as a swift action, and the giant can choose whether to include itself as part of the same swift action. The giant can choose one of the following effects.

Waning: Affected creatures fall asleep as deep slumber. The giants lunar aura is not limited by CR or Hit Dice.
Waxing: Affected creatures gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to the giants CR and gain the ability to make three attacks during a full attack, though each attack takes a 5 penalty (instead of a 4 penalty).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOWpwik9JAT4Q5waL_description
attribs.current: Jalkashti evokes a vertical column of dangerous material from across the universe that rains down upon creatures in the area. This matter is made up of bits of burning stars and chunks of frozen comets, and it deals 4d6 ([[4d6]]) fire damage and 3d6 ([[3d6]]) cold damage to every creature in the area. This damage occurs only once, when the spell is cast. For the spells remaining duration, the fallen starstuff makes the entire area difficult terrain, and thick, swirling clouds of particulate space matter magically block vision. This obscures all sight beyond 5 feet, including darkvision and other vision-based senses (including vision-based blindsight and sense through), but doesnt prevent blindsense. A creature within 5 feet of its attacker has concealment (attacks have a 20% ([[1d00]]%) miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment 50% ([[1d00]]%) miss chance, and the attacker cant use sight to locate the target). Additionally, the swirling cosmic particles are distracting to spellcasters in the area, who have a 20% ([[1d00]]%) chance of losing any spell they attempt to cast in the area. At the end of the duration, the starstuff disappears, leaving no aftereffects (other than the damage dealt).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOZVGuDkVV0siY5y6_description
attribs.current:
Jalkashti sends his mind to another plane of existence (an Elemental Plane or some plane further removed) in order to receive advice and information from powers there. The powers reply in a language they understand, but they resent such contact and give only brief answers to their questions. All questions are answered with Yes, No, Maybe, Never, Irrelevant, or some other one-word answer.

Jalkashti must concentrate on maintaining the spell in order to ask questions at the rate of one per round. A question is answered by the power during the same round. He can ask eight questions. On rare occasions, this divination may be blocked by an act of certain deities or forces.

Contacting a minor planar power is relatively safe but may not result in useful answers. For each question Jalkashti asks, the GM secretly rolls 1d20 ([[1d20]]).

12: The power gives Jalkashti no answer, the spell ends, and he must attempt a DC 7 Intelligence check. On a failed check, his Intelligence and Charisma scores each fall to 8 for a week and he is unable to cast spells for that period.

35: Jalkashti receives a random answer to the question.

610: Jalkashti receives an incorrect answer to the question. Based on the nature and needs of the creature contacted, this may be a lie designed to harm them.

1115: Jalkashti no answer to the question.

16 or More: Jalkashti receives a truthful and useful one-word answer. If the question cant be truthfully answered in this way, no answer is received.

Contact with minds further removed from Jalkashti's home plane increases the probability that he will incur a decrease in Intelligence and Charisma due to his brain being overwhelmed by the powers sheer strangeness and force, but it also increases the chance of the power knowing the answer and answering correctly. He can add any value from +1 to +5 to the d20 roll to represent contacting increasingly powerful planar beings. However, on a roll of 1 or 2, the result is still no answer, the spell ends, and he must attempt an Intelligence check to avoid losing Intelligence and Charisma. The DC of this Intelligence check is increased by the same amount added to the d20 check to contact a planar creature.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOdP5m7XtGrZiBqgH_description
attribs.current:
Jalkashti places a terrible curse on the target, stealing either its overall competency or its ability to think and act on its feet. Choose one of the following.
The target takes a 4 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.
Each turn, the target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action.
Jalkashti can also invent their own curse (see Afflictions on page 414 for a few ideas), but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The curse bestowed by this spell cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break enchantment, miracle, remove affliction, or wish spell.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity. Bestow curse counters remove affliction.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOjlOguUHSboullmJ_target
attribs.current: Up to Fifteen Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOjlOguUHSboullmJ_description
attribs.current: Each round, Jalkashti concentrates on one target within range. They know if the target deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in its aura caused by lying. The spell does not reveal the truth or uncover unintentional inaccuracies, and it doesnt necessarily reveal evasions. Each round, they can concentrate on a different target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOpr59A9CJK1Q2SrG_description
attribs.current:
Similar to augury but more powerful, a divination spell can provide the indoctrinated moon giant with a useful piece of advice in reply to a question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity that is to occur within 1 week. Casting this spell requires them to expend 1 Resolve Point. The advice granted by the spell can be as simple as a short phrase, or it might take the form of a cryptic rhyme or omen. If they dont act on the information, the conditions may change so that the information is no longer useful. The chance for a correct divination is 75% ([[1d100]]%). If the die roll fails, they know the spell failed, unless specific magic yielding false information is at work.

As with augury, multiple castings of divination about the same topic by the same caster use the same die result as the first divination spell and yield the same answer each time.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOtWO7LHw5TYAizN8_description
attribs.current:
Jalkashti gains access to the targets memories and knowledge, and he can pry the information he wants from them involuntarily.

The indoctrinated moon giant can attempt to learn the answer to one question of their choice per round; after each question, the target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 20. If it fails its Bluff check, they gain the answer they desire. If it succeeds at its check, they gain no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and they believe that wrong answer to be the truth. Their questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into their mind. They and the target dont need to speak the same language, though less intelligent creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to their questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngOy9LQ9G2buU5WSrq_description
attribs.current:
Jalkashti creates an invisible magical sensor at a specific location that enables him to hear or see (his choice) almost as if they were there. He doesnt need line of sight or line of effect to create this sensor in a specific spot within range, but the locale must be either a place thats familiar to them or an obvious location, such as inside a cave whose entrance they can see.

The sensor doesnt move, but the indoctrinated moon giant can rotate it in all directions to view the area as desired. This spell functions only on the plane of existence you are currently occupying.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MngP0a-oR5Iw3P4ApXX_description
attribs.current:
Jalkashti grants the semblance of life to a corpse, allowing it to answer questions. He can ask up to six questions. The corpses knowledge is limited to what it knew during life, including the languages it spoke. Answers are brief, cryptic, or repetitive, especially if the creature would have opposed him in life.

If the dead creature was friendly or helpful toward Jalkashti in life, the spell works automatically. Otherwise, the corpse can attempt a Will saving throw to resist the spell as if it were alive. On a successful save, the corpse can refuse to answer his questions or attempt to deceive them using its Bluff skill. The target can speak only about what it knew in life. It cant answer any questions that pertain to events that occurred after its death.

If the corpse has been subjected to speak with dead within the past week, this spell fails. Jalkashti can cast this spell on a corpse that has been deceased for any amount of time, but the body must be mostly intact to be able to respond. A damaged corpse might be able to give partial answers or partially correct answers, but it must have at least a mouth in order to speak at all. This spell does not affect a corpse that has been turned into an undead creature.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat Jalkashti has his waxing lunar aura active.

During Combat Jalkashti first casts bestow curse on whomever he believes to be the PCs leader, to show the error of denying the superiority of the sivvs. He then leaps into melee, hoping to crush a Small PC. He makes multiple slam attacks when possible, benefiting from his own aura.

Morale Jalkashti neither asks for nor offers quarter and fights until slain.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkYpIZ4Q70POG8CyF6_description
attribs.current: Once per day as a standard action, Jalkashti can access rel-state for imprecise long-distance travel. This ability functions as shadow walk.

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: Cold, Mind-Affecting Effects, Paralysis, Poison, Polymorph, Radiation, Sleep, Stunning

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZddweEVZ5sPfMsRd_description
attribs.current:
A 5-foot cloud of cold-resistant nanites continually converts nearby water vapour into freezing cold. The calecor can create the cloud in the same square as a creature and move it up to 30 feet in any direction as a move action on its turn. If the cloud enters (or is created in) a square containing a creature, it cant move any further that round and deals 4d6 cold damage to that creature (Reflex negates). The cold cloud also freezes any unattended objects along its path, dealing them 4d8 ([[4d8]]) acid damage.

If the calecor doesnt move the cloud, it remains where it is; if it shares its square with any creature at the beginning of your turn, that creature must succeed at a Reflex save or take 4d8 ([[4d8]]) cold damage. Any creature that takes damage from the cloud takes 10 additional cold damage at the end of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZvYFu0ex4dIB7UIq_description
attribs.current: A calecors traumatized and divided mind makes the fey dangerous to interact with on a mental level. Any creature that touches a calecor (or is touched by one), uses mind-affecting or mind-reading magic on the fey, or attempts to communicate with it telepathically must attempt a DC 26 Will save. On a failure, the creature takes 6d10 damage and becomes confused for 1 round. The calecor can suppress this ability at will. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZvYFu0ex4dIB7UIq_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Confused for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZJjAHOn42B-jO742_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the calecor can project the mental torment of its ruined mind into the mind of a creature within 250 feet. If the target fails the save against ruined mined, it suffers the effects of that ability.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZfoBC70WNalStL2Y_description
attribs.current:
This spell functions as teleport, except there is no hard range limit and the calecor doesnt need to have seen its destination. The calecor can teleport to anywhere it is familiar with on the planet it is on while casting the spell, or it can teleport to any other planet in the same solar system. It must have an unambiguous idea of which world it wishes to travel to (the third planet from the sun is an acceptable destination, but a habitable world with oceans is not). If the calecor has a specific location on a planet in mind, it arrives there without a chance of failure; otherwise, it arrives at a location that would not immediately be life threatening. If no such safe landing zone exists on the world, such as someone attempting to travel into the sun without the proper precautions in place, the spell simply fails.

The calecor can also attempt to teleport to planets in different solar systems that it has visited before. This increases the casting time to 1 hour and costs a number of Resolve Points equal to the number of days it would take to reach the planet through Drift travel (assume a base engine with a Drift rating of 1; the GM rolls this randomly, after you begin casting the spell). If the calecor doesnt have enough Resolve Points, it spends all the Resolve Points it has available and the spell fails.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZfoBC70WNalStL2Y_target
attribs.current: Calecor and Touched Objects or Touched Willing or Unconscious Creatures

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZfoBC70WNalStL2Y_range
attribs.current: Solar System or Planet; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnkad9MaCky80VVmOXS_description
attribs.current: The calecor moves itself or some other creature to another plane of existence or alternate dimension. If several willing or unconscious creatures are linked by hand in a circle, as many as eight can be affected by a single casting of plane shift. Arriving at a precise location on the intended plane is nigh impossible. From the Material Plane, the calecor can reach any other plane (except for the Drift), though it appears 5 to 500 miles (5d% ([[5d100]])) from the last place one of the targets (its choice) was located last time that target traveled to that plane. If its the first time traveling to a particular plane for all targets, the calecor appears at a random location on the plane, though it can use other means of transit, such as interplanetary teleport, to travel on the new plane. Special rituals, jealously hoarded by powerful technomancers and mystics, can allow the calecor to travel to specific locations on the chosen plane, or even to unknown worlds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnkad9MaCky80VVmOXS_target
attribs.current: One Creature, or up to eight willing or unconscious creatures

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkafyS4q1P-xZiqmTh_description
attribs.current:
The calecor alters the areas terrain and climate to a new terrain and climate type appropriate to the planet or plane. For example, it might transform a desert into plains. To cast this spell, the calecor must spend 6 Resolve Points along with technological gear worth 30,000 credits (which is magically augmented to do much of the terraforming, then consumed by the spell). This magically alters the areas climate and normal plants to those appropriate to the new terrain, but it doesnt affect creatures or the configuration of the ground. Transforming rocky hills into forested areas converts grasses into shrubs and small trees, but it doesnt flatten the hills or change the animals to suit the new environment.

The calecor can alter the climate by one step (cold, temperate, or warm). The maximum extent of the terrain change is up to the GM, but in general it changes to a similar terrain type or by one step within that terrain type (such as from a typical forest to a forest with massive trees or light undergrowth, from a shallow bog to a deep bog, and so on).

Multiple castings of the spell in the same area can create an area with radically different terrain and climate than the surrounding land. The GM can decide that certain terrain shifts are unsustainable and shorten the duration or that some are suitable for the area and extend the duration. This spell could have many secondary effects based on the nature of the change, the type of bordering terrain, and so on; these should be determined by the GM on a case-by-case basis. For example, transforming a desert requires drawing water up from underground to sustain the plants, which could deplete the water table in nearby areas.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZ2MRw6RPZ8WJHf8T_description
attribs.current:
Calecor can control gravity in an area, causing it to reverse, become zero-g, or become extremely strong. A creature or object within the area that succeeds at its saving throw is unaffected (though if it stays in the area, it must succeed at a new save each round or become affected), but it might still suffer secondary effects (such as an object flying up from reversed gravity, or an object falling upon it when the spell ends). The calecor chooses how to have this spell affect gravity when it casts it, and it cannot change it without recasting the spell. If two control gravity spells affect the same area, they negate each other in the area of overlap.

If the calecor reverses gravity in an area, it causes unattached objects and creatures in the area to fall upward and reach the top of the affected area in 1 round. If a solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it in the same manner as they would during a normal downward fall. If an object or creature reaches the top of the spells area without striking anything, it remains there, oscillating slightly, until the spell ends. At the end of the spells duration, affected objects and creatures fall downward. Creatures who can fly or levitate can keep themselves from falling in either direction.

If the calecor increases gravity in the area, creatures and objects weigh twice as much as normal, move at half speed, can jump only half as far as normal, and can lift and carry only half as much as normal. Any flying target has its manoeuvrability worsened by one step (from average to clumsy, for example; minimum clumsy) and plummets to the ground unless it succeeds at a DC 25 Acrobatics check to fly to remain in the air.

An area of zero-g works like the zero gravity environment (see page 402). The calecor can also use this spell to make areas of zero gravity, heavy gravity, or low gravity act as standard gravity for the duration (see page 402).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZ2MRw6RPZ8WJHf8T_effect
attribs.current: Target becomes affected by the change in gravity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZ9E1f1z-E75IPtr9_description
attribs.current:
Immense power shoots from the calecor's finger, with the potential to disintegrate a target where it stands.

When the calecor casts this spell, a thin, green ray springs from its pointing finger. The calecor must make a ranged attack against its targets EAC, but it can add its Charisma ability score bonus to this attack instead of its Dexterity modifier if it is higher. If the calecor hits, the target takes 14d20 damage. Any creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this spell is entirely disintegrated, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust. A disintegrated creatures equipment is unaffected. Only one target is affected per casting of this spell.

When used against an object, the ray simply disintegrates as much as a 10-foot cube of nonliving matter. Thus, the spell disintegrates only part of any very large object or structure targeted. The ray affects even objects constructed entirely of force, but it does not affect other magical effects that are not an object, creature, or force effect.

A creature or object that succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw is partially affected, taking only 4d20 damage. If this damage reduces the creature or object to 0 Hit Points, the target is entirely disintegrated.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZ9E1f1z-E75IPtr9_target
attribs.current: One Creature or Object, or up to a 10-ft. cube of nonliving matter

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZYUuCySLQjSKsHIm_description
attribs.current: The calecor manipulates the energy that swirls around the targets head, pulling it inward and potentially crushing its skull. The calecor must make a ranged attack against the targets EAC to ensure this spell hits the necessary weak spots in the targets head, but its Charisma ability score modifier to this attack roll instead of its Dexterity modifier if it is higher. If the calecor hits and the target fails a Fortitude saving throw, it takes 18d8 damage. If the target succeeds at its saving throw, it instead takes 4d8 damage. The target might die from damage even if it succeeds at its saving throw; in this case, the spell is not a death effect. This spell has no effect against living creatures that dont have an anatomical head.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZZV6QcLkHbqll3Rj_description
attribs.current: The calecor fires a scintillating ray at its target, making a ranged attack against its targets EAC, but it can add its Charisma score bonus to this attack instead of its Dexterity modifier if it is higher. If the calecor hits and its target fails its Will saving throw, the target creatures Intelligence and Charisma scores each drop to 1 (a modifier of 5). The affected creature is unable to use Intelligence- or Charisma-based skills, cast spells, understand language, or communicate coherently. It still knows who its friends are and can follow them and even protect them. The target remains in this state until a miracle, psychic surgery, wish, or similar spell is used to cancel the effect. It cant be removed by effects like break enchantment.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZZV6QcLkHbqll3Rj_effect
attribs.current: Target is unable to use Intelligence- or Charisma-based skills, cast spells, understand language, or communicate coherently.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZZYWQPRsuPBhyxdG_effect
attribs.current: Target is fooled by the illusion.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZZYWQPRsuPBhyxdG_description
attribs.current: Calecor makes terrain look, sound, and smell like some other sort of terrain. Equipment, structures, and vehicles within the area can be hidden or changed in appearance. The illusion includes audible, olfactory, tactile, and visual elements and is effective against cameras, living creatures, robots, and scrying spells. This spell cant disguise or add creatures nor can it make them invisible (though creatures within the area might hide themselves within the illusion just as they can hide themselves within a real location).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZciEpyty6MaAYcAG_description
attribs.current:
With a touch, the calecor heals and invigorates its target, restoring a number of Hit Points. If the target regains all of its Hit Points as a result of this healing, it can apply the remaining healing to itself. On the other hand, if this isnt enough to restore all the targets Hit Points, the calecor can transfer any number of its own Hit Points to the target, healing the target that amount. The calecor cant transfer more Hit Points than it has or more Hit Points than the target is missing.

Mystic cure restores a number of Hit Points to the calecor's target depending on the spells level.

In addition, unlike most healing, when the calecor casts mystic cure as a spell of 4th-level or higher, it has two options to enhance its effects. The first option is to restore an extra 7d8 ([[7d8]]) Hit Points with a 5th-level mystic cure spell. The second option is to bring a target that died within 2 rounds back to life. In addition to healing such a creature, the spell returns the target to life, and the target takes a temporary negative level for 24 hours. This spell cant resuscitate creatures slain by death effects, creatures turned into undead, or creatures whose bodies were destroyed, significantly mutilated, disintegrated, and so on.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZddweEVZ5sPfMsRd_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and 10 Additional Damage at the End of Its Next Turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkZesJDU2uVTrDJ2HF_description
attribs.current: This spell functions in the same way as lesser remove condition, except the calecor removes any one of the following conditions affecting the target: frightened, nauseated, paralyzed, shaken, sickened, or staggered.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The calecor lashes out at any nearby creatures in a fury. It uses its spell-like abilities such as disintegrate and crush skull to eliminate its foes. When reduced to fewer than 200 Hit Points, it casts mystic cure to heal itself.

Morale The enraged Lathlath calecor fights until slain. Only Kalthlo can calms it enough to cease its attacks.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Vheiransch uses their create hologram ability on the first round and, when able to safely do so, on subsequent rounds. Although Vheiransch has powerful melee and ranged attacks, they enjoy seeing the force of the pillars tear their opponents apart. Vheiransch uses their rel-state shuffle ability each round to place up to 3 foes equally between as many pillars as possible (such as in the most dangerous site in the room, equidistant from all six pillars).

Morale Vheiransch not only feels personal animosity toward the PCs for intruding upon their work, but also realizes that vanquishing the greatest heroes of the Pact Worlds will handily demoralize the entire system. Vheiransch therefore fights until destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mnkkl0BkBxyxsArcyXY_description
attribs.current: As a full action that provokes an attack of opportunity, Vheiransch conjures a hardened hologram into any space within 30 feet of an active pillar that doesnt already have a hardened hologram tethered to it. Vheiransch must concentrate to use this ability, and it can be interrupted just like spellcasting. Conjured holograms all resemble Vheiransch and follow their commands. Vheiransch can have only three hardened holograms in existence at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkmKzqrb6k3BtelZ9w_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Vheiransch can manifest and launch a beam of deadly hardlight. This attack has the line and force weapon properties, targets EAC, and has a range increment of 120 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MnkkiQDPWHIqW9BvoZx_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Vheiransch can manifest and launch a beam of deadly hardlight. This attack has the line and force weapon properties, targets EAC, and has a range increment of 120 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkkntWjIPqIJKkRZ5N_description
attribs.current: Vheiransch can briefly enter rel-state on their own. As a move action, they can spend 1 Resolve Point to become incorporeal and move up to their speed. They become corporeal at the end of their movement.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkkpVyBf4vTWOEVMGn_description
attribs.current: As a move action, Vheiransch can shift an item in their possession into rel-state, quantumly entangling the items molecules with their own. This effectively reduces the items bulk to 0 and makes the item impossible to disarm or otherwise remove from Vheiransch, though the item cannot be used. Vheiransch can shift items weighing a total of 10 bulk, though no one item can be more than 4 bulk. Vheiransch can retrieve an item from rel-state as a move action. Anything that Vheiransch placed into rel-state becomes fully real when Vheiransch is killed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkksAkKz6V3yqxZIxQ_description
attribs.current: When Vheiransch is reduced to 0 Hit Points, they vanish, but is restored to full health 24 hours later if the reboot code hasnt been put into the cores computer console.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkkuVFYR08dzoOjJrD_description
attribs.current: Vheiransch can discorporate into a field of static with a thought. If they are hit by an attack or fail a saving throw against a spell, Vheiransch can spend 1 Resolve Point to become incorporeal. Vheiransch can choose whether to become incorporeal for a split second, in which case their incorporeality applies only to the triggering attack or spell effect, or whether to become incorporeal until the beginning of their next turn. They may choose each time they use this ability.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkkXBDN3Z6nx7I5E7O_description
attribs.current: As a move action, Vheiransch can force a creature within 100 feet into rel-state and teleport it to any square within 60 feet of its current location. A successful DC 27 Fortitude save negates this teleportation, but the target is still moved into an adjacent square in the direction of the intended teleportation destination as long as that square isnt occupied. This is a teleportation effect. Vheiransch can instead take a standard action to target up to three creatures with this ability, placing each one in different locations.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkkXBDN3Z6nx7I5E7O_effect
attribs.current: Target is forced into rel-state and teleported.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MnkkuVFYR08dzoOjJrD_usage
attribs.current: Gets Hit or Fails Saving Throw, 1 Resolve Point
